stories.text:
When I write code and have a question about - say - Python, I go to IRC in the Python channel and ask.

The experience is crazy good. Lot's of helpful (even though socially unapt) people who know Python in and out.

But I rarely read anything about IRC anywhere these days. Is there something new that offers the same functionlity?
stories.title: Ask HN: Is there something as good / better as IRC for programming questions?
Dingoes further from dogs than initially thought – study
NvChad is planning to remove custom configs
This week in KDE: Major accent color and Global Theme improvements

stories.text:
You've heard about Peter Cooper, right? The guy running various programming language newsletters (rubyweekly, javascriptweekly, etc.)

Well, I've been trying to "knock off" his style of landing page for the longest time - responsive cell-phone image as a background with responsive iframe inside, but never could get the background cell-phone to behave just right. (yeah, my CSS-fu isn't the strongest, I know...)

Until now...

What I just realized, after god know how many years, is his mobile-phone background images aren't images at all...

They're made with CSS!

Peter, if you're reading this, my hat's off to you! Your "hack" just made my day! Thank you.
stories.title: Tell HN: Peter Cooper's genius mobile-phone background image hack
I also don't like computers anymore
